subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|ic}} – a tied bag ({{zh-l|*𣒚}}), with various items in it ({{zh-l|*𤕦}}). {{och-l|𤕦}} also serves as a phonetic element. There are many alternative forms. In the modern, standard form, the bottom turned into an abbreviated form of {{zh-l|*襄}}, with the result that the character is a {{Han compound|㯻|襄|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p|t1=bag|abb1=y|abb2=y|nocap=y}}. Etymology best preserved in small seal script form.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=náng,nāng
|m_note=nāng - only in Mainland, used in certain compounds ({{zh-l|*囊膪}}, {{zh-l|*囊揣}})
|c=nong4
|j=non1
|mn=lông/zz,tw:long
|mn_note=Zhangzhou, Taiwan: lông - noun; long - verb
|w=3naan
|x=lan2
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=n,v
}}
